member.name: T:Elegant.Ui.ControlInformativeness
member.summary: Represents an abstract base class for informativeness.
member.remarks: Depending on some factors, a controls can have several visual representations that provide different levels of informativeness. For example, when a button is used in the Ribbon, it can be represented with a large image, a small image with text and a small image depending on the Ribbon width.

member.param: Context id.
Control informativeness type.

member.summary: Registers the informativeness type for the given context id.
member.param: Context id.
Control informativeness type.
Specifies whether substitution of an existing value is allowed.

member.name: T:Elegant.Ui.WeakDictionary`2
member.summary: Represents a collection of keys and values, where the keys are stored using weak reference.
member.remarks: The generic class provides a mapping from a set of keys to a set of values. The keys are stored using weak references so that they are not locked for GC. Each addition to the dictionary consists of a value and its associated key. Retrieving a value by using its key is very fast, close to O(1), because the class is implemented as a hash table.
member.typeparam: The type of the keys in the dictionary.
The type of the values in the dictionary.

member.name: T:Elegant.Ui.Calendar
member.summary: Represents a feature-rich calendar control that allows you to select one or multiple days.

remarks.p: The calendar features a single and multi-month layout. The week numbers, non-month days and a month-selection popup provides fast navigation.

The calendar is highly customizable and enables you to easily change almost every aspect of its visual presentation. You can create one or more visual styles and associated these styles with particular days and week numbers. You can even completely redraw and change the size of the days to give your calendar a unique look.

You can select the format of displaying the days of the week: first letter, abbreviated or full. The other customizable properties include the first day of the week, today's date and Today and None buttons.
You can see the major elements of the calendar control below.
You can learn more about Elegant Calendar from Using a Calendar Control

member.name: P:Elegant.Ui.Calendar.NonMonthDaysVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean value that specifies whether the non-month days are displayed in the first and last month blocks.

remarks.para: The method works differently for the following two cases:

ul.li: 1) There is only one month block in the calendar (see Figure 1). The property affects the first and last days that do not belong to the month.

2) There are more than one month blocks in the calendar (see Figure 2). In this case, the property works only for the first days that do not belong to the month in the top left month block and for the last days that do not belong to the month in the bottom right month block.

remarks.p: You can specify how many month blocks are displayed in the calendar using the . You can change the text color of non-month days using .

member.name: T:Infralution.Licensing.EvaluationMonitor
member.summary: Provides a mechanism for managing time/usage limited evaluations of products.

remarks.para: Instantiate an instance of this class to read/write the evaluation parameters for the given product. The is set the first time that the class is instantiated. The is set each time the class is instantiated. The is incremented each time the class is instantiated.

Note that evaluation data must be stored somewhere on the users hard disk. It is therefore not too difficult for a sophisticated user to determine the changes made either to registry keys or files (using file/registry monitoring software) and restore the state of these to their pre-installation state (thus resetting the evaluation period). For this reason it is recommended that you don't rely on this mechanism alone. You should also consider limiting the functionality of your product in some way or adding nag screens to discourage long term use of evaluation versions.

If you have a data oriented application you can increase the security of evaluations by storing the current somewhere in your database each time the application runs and cross checking this with the number returned by the EvaluationMonitor.

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EvaluationMonitor.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the evaluation monitor.
member.remarks: The is incremented each time a new evaluation monitor is instantiated for a product
member.param: A string which uniquely identifies the product.

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EvaluationMonitor.Reset
member.summary: Allows you to reset the evaluation period.
member.remarks: This may be useful if a customer needs an extension or if somehow they invalidate their evaluation data by attempting to fiddle

member.name: F:Elegant.Ui.MessageBoxOptions.DefaultDesktopOnly
member.summary: The message box is displayed on the active desktop. This constant is the same as ServiceNotification except that the system displays the message box only on the default desktop of the interactive window station DefaultDesktopOnly will cause the application that raised the to lose focus. The that is displayed will not use visual styles.

member.name: F:Elegant.Ui.MessageBoxOptions.ServiceNotification
member.summary: The message box is displayed on the active desktop. The caller is a service notifying the user of an event. The function displays a message box on the current active desktop, even if there is no user logged on to the computer.

member.name: T:Elegant.Ui.NotifyIcon
member.summary: Specifies a component that creates an icon in the notification area. This class cannot be inherited.
member.remarks: Icons in the notification area are shortcuts to processes that are running in the background of a computer, such as a virus protection program or a volume control. These processes do not come with their own user interfaces. The NotifyIcon class provides a way to program in this functionality. The property defines the icon that appears in the notification area. Pop-up menus for an icon are addressed with the property. The property assigns ToolTip text. In order for the icon to show up in the notification area, the property must be set to true.

member.name: M:Elegant.Ui.NotifyIcon.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: When a new is created, the property is set to false. You must set the property to true in order to use the you created. This instance will exist until its container releases it to garbage collection.

member.name: M:Elegant.Ui.NotifyIcon.#ctor(System.ComponentModel.IContainer)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified container.
member.remarks: When a new is created, the property is set to false. You must set the property to true in order to use the you created. This instance will exist until its container releases it to garbage collection.
member.param: An that represents the container for the control.

member.summary: Overrides the member from the base class.

member.name: M:Elegant.Ui.NotifyIcon.ShowBalloonTip(System.Int32)
member.summary: Displays a balloon tip in the taskbar for the specified time period.
member.remarks: Minimum and maximum timeout values are enforced by the operating system and are typically 10 and 30 seconds, respectively, however this can vary depending on the operating system. Timeout values that are too large or too small are adjusted to the appropriate minimum or maximum value. In addition, if the user does not appear to be using the computer (no keyboard or mouse events are occurring) then the system does not count this time towards the timeout. Only one balloon tip can display on the taskbar at a time. Attempting to display a balloon tip when one is currently displayed on the taskbar causes the timeout value to be ignored. The behavior is slightly different depending on the operating system and whether the balloon tip is from another, or the same, application. When the second balloon tip is from another application, the first balloon tip will display for the minimum timeout value before the second appears, regardless of the value of timeout. In most cases, if the balloon tips are from the same application, the first balloon tip immediately closes when another call to the ShowBalloonTip method is made. In some cases the second balloon will open on top of the first balloon. The title text will display in a bold font near the top of the balloon.
member.param: The time period, in milliseconds, the balloon tip should display.

member.name: M:Elegant.Ui.NotifyIcon.ShowBalloonTip(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Windows.Forms.ToolTipIcon)
member.summary: Displays a balloon tip with the specified title, text, and icon in the taskbar for the specified time period.
member.remarks: Minimum and maximum timeout values are enforced by the operating system and are typically 10 and 30 seconds, respectively, however this can vary depending on the operating system. Timeout values that are too large or too small are adjusted to the appropriate minimum or maximum value. In addition, if the user does not appear to be using the computer (no keyboard or mouse events are occurring) then the system does not count this time towards the timeout. Only one balloon tip can display on the taskbar at a time. Attempting to display a balloon tip when one is currently displayed on the taskbar causes the timeout value to be ignored. The behavior is slightly different depending on the operating system and whether the balloon tip is from another, or the same, application. When the second balloon tip is from another application, the first balloon tip will display for the minimum timeout value before the second appears, regardless of the value of timeout. In most cases, if the balloon tips are from the same application, the first balloon tip immediately closes when another call to the ShowBalloonTip method is made. In some cases the second balloon will open on top of the first balloon. The title text will display in a bold font near the top of the balloon.
member.param: The time period, in milliseconds, the balloon tip should display.
The title to display on the balloon tip.
The text to display on the balloon tip.
One of the values.

member.name: T:Elegant.Ui.GalleryItem
member.summary: Implements a gallery item.

remarks.para: You can use GalleryItem as a ready-to-use class for gallery items. If you would like to use a custom class for gallery items, you should provide the gallery with information about its properties, for instance, which property stores the image that will be displayed in a gallery item. You can do this by setting the Gallery.ItemXXXPropertyName properties (e.g. Gallery.ItemImagePropertyName).

member.name: T:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicense
member.summary: Defines an encrypted license for a component or control generated using the Infralution Licensing System.
member.remarks: The Infralution Licensing System provides a secure way of licensing .NET controls, components and applications. Licenses are protected using public key encryption to minimize possibility of cracking.

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicense.#ctor(System.String,System.UInt16,System.String)
member.summary: Create a new Infralution Encrypted License
member.param: The key for the license.
The serial number of the license.
The product data associated with the license.

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicense.Dispose
member.summary: Cleans up any resources held by the license

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicense.Checksum(System.String)
member.summary: Returns a four character checksum based on the given input string
member.param: The input string to return a checksum for.
member.returns: An checksum that can be used to validate the given input string

remarks.para: This function can be used to generate a short checksum that can be embedded in a license key as . This allows you to tie the license key to information supplied by the user (for instance the name of the purchaser) without having to include the full information in the license key. This enables license keys to be kept reasonably short.

When the license is checked by the application it performs a checksum on the information supplied by the user and checks that it matches the information in the ProductInfo that was generated when the license was issued. The License Tracker application provides support for "CustomGenerators" which allow you provide the code to generate the ProductInfo from customer and other information.

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicense.HashString(System.String)
member.summary: Implements a string hashing code algorithm equivalent to the .NET 2003 String.GetHashCode()
member.remarks: Microsoft have changed the underlying String.GetHashCode algorithm. This method provides an equivalent compatible method that can be used on all platforms returning the same result.
member.param: The string to get the hash code for.
member.returns: The hash code

member.name: P:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicense.LicenseKey
member.summary: The license key for the license

member.name: P:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicense.ProductInfo
member.summary: The product data associated with the license

member.name: P:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicense.SerialNo
member.summary: The unique serial no for the license

member.name: T:Elegant.Ui.GalleryItemCategoryFilter
member.summary: Implements a filter for gallery categories.

remarks.para: Each filter has its name and refers to one or more categories by names. This set of categories become visible in the gallery pop-up window when the filter is applied. The user can apply the filter by selecting it in the gallery's filter menu.

To define a filter, create a new instance of this class, set its Name and CategoryNames properties, and add it to the Gallery.CategoryFilterItems collection. After that the created filter will be available in the gallery's filter menu.

member.name: M:Elegant.Ui.GalleryItemCategoryFilter.#ctor
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the GalleryItemCategoryFilter class.

member.name: M:Elegant.Ui.GalleryItemCategoryFilter.#ctor(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Initialize a new instance of the GalleryItemCategoryFilter class.
member.param: Filter name.
Array of category names.

member.name: P:Elegant.Ui.GalleryItemCategoryFilter.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the filter name.

member.name: P:Elegant.Ui.GalleryItemCategoryFilter.CategoryNames
member.summary: Gets the collection that contains the names of the gallery categories by which gallery items will be filtered.

member.name: T:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider
member.summary: Defines a .NET LicenseProvider that uses encrypted licenses generated by the Infralution Licensing System.

remarks.p: The Infralution Licensing System provides a secure way of licensing .NET controls, components and applications. Licenses are protected using public key encryption to minimize possibility of cracking.
Components or controls use the to specify this class as the LicenseProvider

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.SetParameters(System.String)
member.summary: Set the parameters used to validate licenses created by this provider.
member.remarks: This must be called by the client software prior to obtaining licenses using the EncryptedLicenseProvider. The parameters are generated using the Infralution License Key Generator and pasted into the calling client code.
member.param: An XML string containing parameters used to validate licenses.

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.GenerateLicenseParameters(System.String)
member.summary: Generate the XML license parameter string that is used to validate licenses generated using the given password
member.param: The password used to encrypted the license data.
member.returns: An XML string which is used to initialise the EncryptedLicenseProvider

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.GenerateKey(System.String,System.String,System.UInt16)
member.summary: Generate a new encrypted license using the given password
member.param: The password used to encrypted the license data.
User defined data about the product being licensed.
The unique license serial number.
member.returns: A hex encoded ecnrypted license key
member.remarks: If there is no installed license for the Infralution Licensing System then the only allowed password is "TEST" and the only allowed serial numbers are 1 or 0. To use the licensed version of this method ensure that the file Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.lic exists in the same directory as the Infralution.Licensing.dll and contains a valid license key for the Licensing System.

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.InstallLicense(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Install a license key for the given component or control type.

remarks.para: This method is used to install licenses for components and controls. The method is typically better for installing application licenses because it provides more control over the license key file name. This license key file used by this method is the full type name followed by a ".lic" suffix.

This method verifies that the key is valid and if it is creates the license file and stores the license key. The generic Infralution.Licensing.LicenseInstallForm uses this method to install licenses for types. Client components may implement their own registration forms that call this method.
The method MUST be called before using this method.

member.param: The type to install the license for.
The license key to install.
member.returns: A license if succesful or null/nothing if not

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.InstallLicense(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Install a license key for an application in the given file.

remarks.para: This method is used to install licenses for applications. Use the method to install licenses for components or controls. If a full path is not specified for licenseFile then the file will be created relative to the entry executable directory.

This method verifies that the key is valid and if it is creates a license file with the given name and stores the license key. This method is used by client applications to allow customers to install a license for an application. The generic Infralution.Licensing.LicenseInstallForm uses this method to install licenses for applications. Client applications may implement their own registration forms that call this method.
The method MUST be called before using this method.

member.param: The name of the file to install the license key in.
The license key to install.
member.returns: A license if succesful or null/nothing if not

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.InstallLicense(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Install a license key for an application in the given file.

remarks.para: This method is used to install licenses for applications. Use the method to install licenses for components or controls. If a full path is not specified for licenseFile then the file will be created relative to the entry executable directory.

This method verifies that the key is valid and if it is creates a license file with the given name and stores the license key. This method is used by client applications to allow customers to install a license for an application. The generic Infralution.Licensing.LicenseInstallForm uses this method to install licenses for applications. Client applications may implement their own registration forms that call this method.
This method is an alternative to calling followed by .

member.param: An XML string containing parameters used to validate the license key.
The name of the file to install the license key in.
The license key to install.
member.returns: A license if succesful or null/nothing if not

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.ValidateLicenseKey(System.String)
member.summary: Validate that the given license key is valid for the current licensing parameters
member.param: The license key to validate.
member.returns: The encrypted license if the key is valid otherwise null

remarks.para: This method provides a mechanism to validate that a given license key is valid prior to attempting to install it. This can be useful if you want to check the before installing the license.
The method MUST be called before using this method.

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.ValidateLicenseKey(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Validate that the given license key is valid for the given licensing parameters
member.param: An XML string containing parameters used to validate the license key.
The license key to validate.
member.returns: The encrypted license if the key is valid otherwise null

remarks.para: This method provides a mechanism to validate that a given license key is valid prior to attempting to install it. This can be useful if you want to check the before installing the license.
This method is an alternative to calling followed by .

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.GetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Get a license (if installed) from the given license file.
member.param: The name of the license file containing the license key.
member.returns: The installed license key if any

remarks.para: This method is used to read licenses for applications. Components and controls should use the methods to load and validate licenses. If a full path is not specified for licenseFile then the file loaded will be relative to the directory containing the application executable (for Window Forms applications) or aspx files (for ASP.NET applications).
The method MUST be called before using this method.

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.GetLicense(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Get a license (if installed) from the given license file.
member.param: An XML string containing parameters used to validate the license key.
The name of the license file containing the license key.
member.returns: The installed license key if any

remarks.para: This method is used to read licenses for applications. Components and controls should use the methods to read and validate licenses. If a full path is not specified for licenseFile then the file loaded will be relative to the directory containing the application executable (for Window Forms applications) or aspx files (for ASP.NET applications).
This method is an alternative to calling followed by .

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.GetLicense(System.ComponentModel.LicenseContext,System.Reflection.Assembly,System.Type)
member.summary: Return the license for the given type from a given DLL assembly resources
member.param: The license context to validate the license in.
The assembly containing the license.
The type to get the license for.
member.remarks: This method can be used to check the given DLL assembly for a license. By default the .NET licensing framework only checks the entry assembly (ie typically executables) for licenses. This means that if a licensed control is wrapped in another control, the customer of the wrapped control will still required a design time license key for the original control. This is generally the behaviour that control authors would like. If however you want to provide a license that enables a customer to create new component/controls using your control/component then you can achieve this by using this method to check for a license in the CallingAssembly that created the control/component.

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.ExtractLicense(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Return the license information from the given license key
member.param: The license key to extract the license information from.
The password - required to open the license key.
member.returns: The license data if successful or null if not

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.ArraySize(System.Int32)
member.summary: Return the array size to use when declaring an array of the given length.
member.param: The length of the array you are declaring.
member.returns: The size to declare the array
member.remarks: This is used to account for the difference between declaring VB and C# arrays and permit automatic conversion of the code to VB

member.summary: Return the given input string stripped of the given characters

member.returns: The input string with the given characters removed

member.summary: Converts a hexadecimal string into a byte array.

member.returns: The converted byte data

member.summary: Are the contents of the two byte arrays equal
member.param: The first array.
The second array.
member.returns: True if the contents of the arrays is equal

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.GetEncryptionKey(System.String)
member.summary: Generate an 8 byte DES encryption key using the given password
member.remarks: Only the first 7 bytes of the key returned are used. This enables us to reduce the size of the final license keys by 8 bytes.
member.param: The password used to generate the key.
member.returns: An 8 byte key

member.returns: A license for the given type or NULL if the licenseKey was invalid

member.summary: Write a license key to the given file

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.GetLicenseKey(System.ComponentModel.LicenseContext,System.Type)
member.summary: Return the license key for the given context and type
member.remarks: This can be overridden to change where the license key is stored by the provider. For instance a derived class could override this method to store the key in the Registry.
member.param: The license context.
The type to get the key for.
member.returns: The license key

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.GetLicenseDirectory(System.ComponentModel.LicenseContext,System.Type)
member.summary: Return the directory used to store license files
member.param: The licence context.
The type being licensed.
member.returns: The directory to look for license files

member.name: M:Infralution.Licensing.EncryptedLicenseProvider.GetLicenseFilePath(System.ComponentModel.LicenseContext,System.Type)
member.summary: Called by GetLicenseKey to get the file path to obtain the license from (if there is no runtime license saved in the context)
member.remarks: This can be overridden to change the file used to store the design time license for the provider. By default the the license file is stored in the same directory as the component executable with the name based on the fully qualified type name eg MyNamespace.MyControl.lic
member.param: The licence context.
The type to get the license for.
member.returns: The path of the license file

member.name: T:Elegant.Ui.GalleryInteractionMode
member.summary: Defines supported interaction modes for gallery items. You can set the mode by using the Gallery.InteractionMode property.

member.name: F:Elegant.Ui.GalleryInteractionMode.Selection
member.summary: Selection interaction mode. The user selects an item and it remains visually distinct from unselected items (like a toggle button) There can be only one selected item in the gallery. Use Gallery.SelectedItem to retrive the currently selected item. If the gallery is associated with a command, you can also use Data property of the attached command.

member.name: F:Elegant.Ui.GalleryInteractionMode.Action
member.summary: Action interaction mode. The user clicks an item and some action takes place (like a push button). Use Gallery.ItemClick event to handle item clicks. If the gallery is associated with a command, you can also handle execution of the attached command.

member.name: T:Elegant.Ui.DateTimePicker
member.summary: Enables the user to select a date and time, and to display the date and time in a specified format.

remarks.p: The date/time picker consists of the following elements: date and time fields, up and down buttons, calendar drop-down button and calendar popup (see the figure below).

img.alt: Date/Time Picker control and its elements

remarks.p: Date/Time Picker control and its elements
You can learn more about Elegant Date/Time Picker from Using a DateTimePicker Control

member.name: P:Elegant.Ui.DateTimePicker.IncrementOrDecrementWholeDate
member.summary: Gets or sets a boolean flag indicating whether the whole date and time is affected when the value of one of its part has been changed.
member.remarks: For example, if the current date is 12/31/2008 and the user selects the day part, which is 31, and clicks the up button, then depending on this property the control behaves differently. If IncrementOrDecrementWholeDate is true, the date will be 1/1/2009; otherwise, 12/1/2008.

member.name: T:Elegant.Ui.Gallery
member.summary: Implements a gallery control.

remarks.para: A gallery is similar to a menu or a list view, but allows the user to see the preview of the actions associated with gallery items. but look very different.
You can populate the gallery using the Items collection (unbound mode) or the DataSource property (bound mode).

Each gallery item supports the following properties: Image, CategoryName and TooltipText. You can set these properties directly for each gallery item it they are represented by the GalleryItem class. You can also use any custom class for gallery items. In this case, you should set the ItemXXXPropertyName properties for the gallery. For example, if your custom class has a Photo property that represents an image to be displayed in gallery items, you should set the ItemImagePropertyName property to Photo.
You can assign an image to each item or redraw it manually. For details, see ItemDrawMode property.

The size of gallery items size is controlled by ItemWidth and ItemHeight properties. In cases when the gallery is a child of a ribbon group, use the Ribbon.SetGalleryItemHeightMeasurementMode() method to specify one of predefined heights. You can control the gallery width by setting the MaximumItemsInRowCount and MinimumItemsInRowCount properties.

The gallery supports two types of user interaction: Selection, when the user selects one of gallery items and it remains visually distinct from unselected items, and Action, when the user clicks an item, some action takes place and the item restores its visual state. You can set the user interaction mode by using InteractionMode property. To learn more about Selection interaction mode, see SelectedItem, SelectedItemChanged members. To learn more about the Action interaction mode, see ItemClick event. In both interaction modes you can use commands. In the Selection mode, command data changes as a result of click, in the Action mode, a command is executed.
You can can monitor the gallery item that it currently hovered by the mouse pointer. See HoveredItem, HoveredItemChanged members.
The gallery has a menu attached at the bottom. You can add, delete or modify items in the menu by using Popup.

The gallery items in the gallery pop-up window can be categorized and/or filtered. To define categories, use the ItemCategories collection. To enable filtering and define filters, use CategoryFilterEnabled and CategoryFilterItems properties.
The pop-up window can be resized by the user. To modify the way the pop-up window can be resized, use the PopupResizeMode property.

member.name: P:Elegant.Ui.Gallery.InteractionMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the user interaction mode.
member.remarks: There are two user iteraction modes supported: Selection, when the user selects an item and it remains selected and visually distinct from unselected items, and Action, when the user clicks an item, some action takes place but the item does not remain selected. Selection is set by default.

member.name: P:Elegant.Ui.Gallery.DataSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the data source bound to the gallery.
member.remarks:
The Gallery class supports the standard Windows Forms data-binding model. That means the data source can be of any type that implements one of the following interfaces:
The IList interface, including one-dimensional arrays.
The IListSource interface, such as the DataTable and DataSet classes.
The IBindingList interface, such as the BindingList class.
The IBindingListView interface, such as the BindingSource class.

member.name: E:Elegant.Ui.Gallery.DataSourceChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the DataSource property changes.

member.name: P:Elegant.Ui.Gallery.DataMember
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the list or table in the data source which the gallery is bound to.
member.remarks: This property can be useful when binding a gallery to a data source that contains multiple lists or tables. You do not need to set this property when binding to a data source that contains a single list or table. For example, you can bind a DataGridView control to a DataSet that contains a single table without setting this property. If the DataSet contains multiple tables, you should set this property to the name of one of the tables.

member.name: E:Elegant.Ui.Gallery.DataMemberChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the DataMember property changes.

member.name: P:Elegant.Ui.Gallery.Items
member.summary: Gets the collection of gallery items.
member.remarks: When the gallery is bound to a data source, this collection is read-only. You can populate the collection with instances of any, but the same, type. A set of Gallery.ItemXXXPropertyName properties (e.g. Gallery.ItemImagePropertyName allow you to associte the properties of gallery items (e.g. the image) with corresponding properties of the items added to the collection. Alternatively you can use the GalleryItem type. In this case, you can leave the Gallery.ItemXXXPropertyName properties empty.
